metadata.title: Unified Theory of Gravity and Fundamental Fields (UGF)
metadata.description:
This work presents the Unified Theory of Gravity and Funda-
mental Fields (UGF), a reformulation of gravitational interaction
as an emergent effect derived from the Higgs field. Building on the
principles of the Gravity Theory (GT), the gravitational scalar field
ϕg(x) is defined as a functional derivative of the Higgs field ϕH(x) with
respect to mass, ϕg(x) = ∂ϕH(x)/∂m, implying that gravitation orig-
inates from variations in the mechanism of mass generation. Within
a flat Minkowskian spacetime background, the theory unifies gravity
with the Standard Model fields through a single extended Lagrangian:
S = Zd4x [LSM + LH + Lg + Lint + Lconstr] ,
where the effective metric g eff µν emerges from bilinear derivatives of ϕH.
The resulting framework predicts the gravitational field as a secondary,
scalar-induced phenomenon that reproduces General Relativity (GR)
at macroscopic scales while remaining quantum-compatible. Cosmo-
logical implications include the avoidance of singularities, a finite-
density “black-star” structure, and a fractal-spectral interpretation
of dark matter and dark energy. The UGF provides a consistent the-
oretical bridge between the Higgs mechanism, quantum field theory,
and emergent gravitation.

metadata.title: An Enlightening Perspective on Quantum Time
metadata.description: This paper identifies a long-overlooked issue in foundational physics and proposes a tentative solution: Einstein's clock synchronization scheme cannot be realized at the quantum scale, yet Quantum Field Theory (QFT) employs this unexamined scheme and relies on continuous spacetime coordinates as its foundation. This paper presents a new scheme for defining simultaneity at the quantum scale. Within this scheme, interesting conclusions such as discrete spacetime can be derived, illustrating how it can provide a foundation for the ultraviolet cutoff in renormalization methods, and also offer a possible operational basis for the background spacetime of QFT. It further discusses how to recover traditional Lorentz transformations and the Schrödinger equation by stipulating good clocks, and presents some currently testable corollaries.
references: [1]A Einstein .On the Electrodynamics of Moving Bodies [J] .Annalen der Physik, 1970, 17(3):160-183.DOI:10.1016/B978-0-08-006995-1.50014-4.
[2]M E Peskin , D V Schroeder .An Introduction to Quantum Field Theory[M].BeiJing:World Publishing Corporation ,2020
[3]S Weinberg .The Quantum Theory of Fields[M].BeiJing:World Publishing Corporation, 2014.
[4]Carlo Rovelli .Time in quantum gravity: An hypothesis [J].Physical Review D Particles & Fields, 1991, 43(2):442. DOI:10.1103/PhysRevD.44.1337.
[5]R D Sorkin .Relativity theory does not imply that the future already exists: a counterexample [J].Springer Netherlands, 2007. DOI:10.1007/978-1-4020-6318-3_9.
[6]F Dowker  .The birth of spacetime atoms as the passage of time [J]. Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences, 2015, 1326:18-25. DOI:10.1111/nyas.12542.
[7]D N Page , W K Wootters . Evolution without evolution: Dynamics described by stationary observables [J].Physical Review D, 1983, 27(12):2885-2892. DOI:10.1103/PhysRevD.27.2885.
[8]Ngo Phuc Duc Loc .Time-system entanglement and special relativity[J].Modern Physics Letters, A, 2024, 39(1). DOI:10.1142/S0217732323501833
[9]Zixia Wei  .Observers and Timekeepers: From the Page-Wootters Mechanism to the Gravitational Path Integral 2025. arXiv:2506.21489 [hep-th]
[10]W M Itano , Heinzen D J , Bollinger J J ,et al.Quantum Zeno effect[J].Physical Review A, 1990, 41(5):2295.DOI:10.1103/PhysRevA.41.2295.
[11]Zheng Zhao . Fundamentals of General Relativity[M].BeiJing: Tsinghua University Press, 2010: pp226-pp231.
metadata.notes:
Manuscript Status Note:

This is a preliminary research manuscript intended to stimulate discussion on a foundational issue in quantum physics. It presents a complete conceptual framework and a physical derivation of its key results (including the recovery of Lorentz invariance). The author explicitly acknowledges that the work is not yet fully formalized mathematically and welcomes feedback and collaboration to strengthen its theoretical rigor.

metadata.title: Postulati Trinamici XXXIV–LII - Serie Cronodinamica – Dalla Coerenza del Tempo alla Dimensione della Realtà
metadata.description:
Postulati Trinamici XXXIV–LII

Serie Cronodinamica – Dalla Coerenza del Tempo alla Dimensione della Realtà

N° Titolo suggerito Tema centrale
XXXIV (34) L’Equilibrio Aureo tra Energia e Tempo Introduzione alla coerenza elastica Ea–Δt
XXXV (35) La Luce come Tensione Temporale Quantizzata La luce come veicolo del tempo elastico
XXXVI (36) La Memoria del Campo e l’Impronta del Tempo Il tempo come memoria energetica del campo
XXXVII (37) La Simmetria Aurea del Divenire Armonia aurea fra variazioni temporali e flussi energetici
XXXVIII (38) Il Tempo Relativo come Stato di Equilibrio Dinamico Il tempo non assoluto ma dipendente dalla tensione locale
XXXIX (39) La Coerenza del Campo Temporale Elastico Struttura e stabilità del tempo nei sistemi coerenti
XL (40) La Gravità come Equilibrio Elastico del Tempo La gravità come effetto del tempo tensionale
XLI (41) Il Tempo come Forza di Coesione della Materia Il tempo mantiene uniti energia e massa
XLII (42) L’Entanglement come Memoria Temporale del Campo Collegamento istantaneo come effetto della memoria Δtφ
XLIII (43) La Direzionalità del Tempo e la Curvatura del Campo Origine del flusso temporale e della sua asimmetria
XLIV (44) Il Ritmo Trinamico dell’Universo Alternanza di espansione, equilibrio e ritorno
XLV (45) La Quantizzazione Aurea 72-Φl-bit Unità minima del tempo luminoso coerente
XLVI (46) La Relazione tra Ea, Δtφ e kt Fondamento dei parametri trinamici di misura
XLVII (47) Il Principio di Elasticità Universale Tutto ciò che esiste obbedisce alla tensione temporale
XLVIII (48) La Persistenza dell’Informazione Energetica Il tempo conserva la traccia dell’energia
XLIX (49) La Risonanza Aurea del Tempo Oscillazioni armoniche come base della coerenza cosmica
L (50) La Sincronia del Campo Trinamico Tutti i sistemi coerenti vibrano in fase aurea
LI (51) La Dualità del Tempo: Lineare ed Elastico Due nature del tempo: percepito e reale
LII (52) La Coerenza Aurea Generativa del Tempo Il tempo come generatore della forma e dell’ordine

metadata.title: Cosmology of Quantum Triadic Graphs
metadata.description:
This paper presents Cosmology of Quantum Triadic Graphs: Structural Emergence in the Relational Time Superposition Hypothesis (RTSH) Model, the first computational formulation of a cosmological network governed by quantum-inspired causal rules. In this model, new nodes attach to a growing causal graph through a Grover-based quantum selection mechanism, followed by a coherence-driven quantum triadic closure and a semilocal causal noise term.

The resulting networks exhibit filamentary and quasi-spherical morphologies, high clustering coefficients, truncated power-law degree distributions, and small-world causal coherence — structural signatures reminiscent of the large-scale cosmic web. The paper interprets these properties within the RTSH framework, where spacetime emerges as a self-optimizing network of quantum collapses.

To our knowledge, this is the first formulation of a quantum triadic closure mechanism — a coherence-driven analogue of classical triadic closure — designed to capture local reinforcement of causal correlations in quantum-relational networks.

The full simulation code (Qiskit + NetworkX + Matplotlib) is included as Appendix C and reproduces all figures and metrics discussed in the text.

Keywords:
RTSH, quantum networks, causal graphs, triadic closure, Grover algorithm, emergent spacetime, complex systems, cosmology of graphs.
references: Penrose, R. (1996). On Gravity's Role in Quantum State Reduction. General Rela tivity and Gravitation, 28(5), 581–600
Penrose, R. (2016). Fashion, Faith, and Fantasy in the New Physics of the Universe.  Princeton University Press
Grover, L. K. (1997). Quantum Mechanics Helps in Searching for a Needle in a  Haystack. Physical Review Letters, 79(2), 325–328
Barabási, A.-L., & Albert, R. (1999). Emergence of Scaling in Random Networks.  Science, 286(5439), 509–512
Watts, D. J., & Strogatz, S. H. (1998). Collective Dynamics of 'Small-World' Net works. Nature, 393(6684), 440–442
Sorkin, R. D. (2003). Causal Sets: Discrete Gravity. In A. Gomberoff & D. Marolf  (Eds.), Lectures on Quantum Gravity (pp. 305–327). Springer
Gonçalves, C. (2025). Relational Time Superposition Hypothesis (RTSH) (Versão v4). Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.16623845

links.self: https://zenodo.org/api/records/17497384

metadata.title: R.(e)E.I Theory: Relation–(emergent)Energy–Information Emergent Energy and Geometry from Relational and Informational Flows
metadata.description:
REI Theory (Relation–(emergent)Energy–Information) is a timeless, constraint-first framework in which geometry, time, and matter emerge from conserved relational flows on a spaceless graph. This version expands the original RIFT preprint (DOI 10.5281/zenodo.17460864) into a full 8-page manuscript.

Key updates • Refined Figure 1: pyramid architecture with bidirectional emergence and back-action; weak-field bridge Φ = c² δσ (fixes earlier D typo). • Expanded routing, successor map, and SOC avalanche sections. • Full notation table and executable pseudocode. • Minor LaTeX and equation clean-ups.

Core model unchanged: H_REI = 0, ℓ_e = e^{-σ_e}, path-sum QM, area-law entropy. Ready for analog tests.
keywords: emergent gravity, relational QM, SOC, graph flows, timeless substrate, pre-geometric

metadata.title: Gravity Theory
metadata.description:
This paper presents a novel Gravity Theory (GT) that reinterprets the gravitational field as being derived from the Higgs field within a flat spacetime framework.
Unlike General Relativity (GR), which attributes gravity to spacetime curvature, GT integrates quantum corrections, nonlinear dynamics, and a variable speed of light to describe gravitational phenomena [1]. The theory successfully predicts key cosmic phenomena such as the expansion of the universe [6], gravitational time dilation, and light deflection, while addressing discrepancies in observational data, such as the nature of gravitational waves [4]. By calibrating the coupling constant λ using empirical data from cosmological expansion instead of perihelion precession or light deflection, KGT shows potential as a bridge between quantum mechanics and cosmology, offering a new perspective on gravity that
does not rely on dark energy or spacetime curvature.
references: https://youtu.be/brAuUhxmVzo?si=tALEFDEO1QouKzy9
https://youtu.be/YhI3dtXHfMo?si=PHfVZE5ho6h1vkL6

metadata.title: Shaking Tangled Dimensions -  A Nascent Theory of Everything
metadata.description:
Shaking Tangled Dimensions introduces a novel theoretical framework that aims to unify the fundamental forces of nature by proposing a discrete, quantized structure of space-time composed of dynamic, intersecting dimensions called "Cores." These cores—built from spatial, electrical, and dark dimensions—form a structured lattice that gives rise to gravity, electromagnetism, and the properties of fundamental particles through geometric and angular relationships.

This theory departs from traditional approaches by treating particles such as electrons, quarks, and neutrinos as quantized distortions (or “kinks”) in the electrical dimensions of the cores. Gravity emerges not from a curvature of a smooth space-time continuum, but from the volumetric overlap and angular inclination of spatial dimensions relative to a central reference point. The model provides geometric interpretations of quantum uncertainty, spin, and the fine structure constant, while also offering fresh perspectives on the double-slit experiment, neutrino oscillations, the Higgs boson, and dark matter.

Bridging the conceptual divide between quantum mechanics and general relativity, the Tangled Dimensions model seeks to replace probabilistic quantum interpretations with a deterministic, field-based understanding of physical reality. It challenges entrenched assumptions, providing testable predictions and conceptual clarity, while retaining compatibility with observed phenomena.

Version 4 incorporated new material linking the Tangled Dimensions lattice to Barandes’ Stochastic–Quantum correspondence, showing how the model provides a microphysical origin for the stochastic dynamics that underlie quantum mechanics. By situating quantum behavior within the oscillatory structure of the Cores, this version deepens the bridge between determinism and quantum theory while retaining accessibility for a broad physics audience.

Anybody want to endorse this so it can be posted on arVix?
references: J. A. Barandes, Quantum Systems as Indivisible Stochastic Processes, arXiv:2507.21192v1 [quant-ph] 27 Jul 2025

data.title: Shaking Tangled Dimensions -  A Nascent Theory of Everything

metadata.title: Study of the Function, Design, Operational Life and Simulation of an Over-Center Valve in Hydraulic Systems
metadata.description: Hydraulic systems have long played a central role in executing heavy industrial operations, such as lifting loads or driving equipment like excavators and trucks. One of the most common challenges facing these systems is maintaining load stability during sudden dynamic shifts, such as a change in the center of gravity when lifting a load with cranes or traversing uneven terrain. These situations impose abnormal loads on the hydraulic system, which can damage components, reduce equipment lifespan, or endanger the operator. In response to these challenges, the over-center valve design emerged as a key solution. This paper discusses the function, design evolution, operational lifespan, and simulation analysis of over-center valves in hydraulic circuits. It compares standard, part-balanced, and fully balanced valve types, clarifying how each responds to back pressure and pilot control under different operating conditions. The study emphasizes the importance of proper material selection, seal quality, and routine maintenance in extending the life of the valve. Using FluidSIM software, a simulation was performed to demonstrate the valve’s role in absorbing dynamic load variations and maintaining controlled motion during load reversal. The results highlight the valve’s effectiveness in stabilizing system behavior during transient phases. The study concludes that over-center valves are essential components for ensuring system safety and performance, especially in closed-center and heavy-load applications. Their ability to manage sudden changes in load direction while protecting the hydraulic circuit makes them indispensable in modern hydraulic system design.
